All Reviews

  1. The mirror I received is sadly un-enchanted and fogs up horribly. I didn't use any cleaning products on it. It mounts nicely on the shower wall, but the whole fogging up thing just blows.
  2. What can I say? This product is your average plastic composite oval shaving mirror. Worth the price but nothing special or super anti-fog. If you don't want it to fog, run it under the shower water before you use it. No more complex than that. No &#34;anti-fog technology.&#34; The mounting hook is sticky and hasn't come loose yet after 1.5 months. Ok product.
  3. This mirror was easy to install, and works really well. When humidity gets to a certain level, it can fog up. But, simply rinsing it quickly under the water refreshes the surface, and it provides a very clear reflection. I'm glad to finally have a mirror for shaving in the shower!
  4. I just got this last week and so far I love it. It really doesn't fog up at all!
  5. Excellent customer service and great product!
  6. Generally, these things start to get cruddy over time so we'll see, but so far I'm happy.
  7. Have had this shower mirror for 2 weeks and it fogs. Sorry, I had high hopes for this thing but like all other shower mirrors it just can't resist the steam. That said, the price is relatively low and on point with other shower mirrors (who don't necessarily tout the same promise of being fogless) so I can't complain about that. I wouldn't have purchased it had it cost more. All in all, it's fine for just a run-of-the-mill shower mirror. I will say that the hook it comes with is fairly permanent (comes with a sticker on the back of the hook), but the mirror just hangs on that without IT being affixed to the wall, so it's quite easy for me to just pull off the mirror and run it under the water to clear it off again then hang back up again. Prior to purchasing this I had been looking at other more permanent mirrors, and I'm glad I actually bought this one instead for the simple reason that the fog is easily remedied!
  8. Stayed fogless through my first shower. If I wipe bar soap on my fingers and wipe the mirror it stays fogless.
  9. My regular mirror has less fog than my fogless mirror
  10. Thank you for reading my review. I love this product! I was able to install it in a matter of a few minutes, following the easy to read instructions that are enclosed in the box. It is great for men and women to use. Men for shaving of course and women for checking to make sure we get all the residual makeup etc off as we shower. I personally find this very convenient to avoid the dreaded raccoon eye. It is definitely fog free, and I think it should remain like this as long as I follow the instructions. I would recommend this as a great addition to any bathroom.
  11. When I first used this mirror, I was experiencing problems similar to some of the poor reviews here. I got an email from the manufacturer, and told them of my problems. The mirror was fogging immediately, and the image was kind of poor, even with the shower off. I had followed all the instructions and was ready to return it. They immediately offered to replace it, but I declined. Fortunately, my wife discovered that there was still a clear plastic film on the outside of the mirror. It was practically impossible to see it, but \\"scratches\\" showed up on the mirror with it still attached. If you are having problems, make sure you remove this film. There was a sticker on the front that said it should be removed, and the sticker came off easily, but apparently it was referring to the film. The film on the back had a paper backing, so it was obvious that it had to be removed. With the film removed, the mirror stays fog free, even without heating it in the shower. I have it positioned on the side where it does get sprinkled with water, but even that does not cause it to fog. I gave it 4 stars instead of five, because the instructions were unclear (I read them carefully), and it is kind of ugly looking with no frame. It is just a cut out piece of plastic. However, it does do the job well, and stays clear while I shave.
  12. Works Great. The adhesive hook is a plus for tile showers!
  13. I was excited when I was given the chance to review this product! I recently tried the Cassani Fogless Shower Mirror, which claims that it can help you to achieve a perfect, flawless shave every time and will never fog up on you. Me being a girl and all I do NOT shave my face LOL, but the mirror is still handy to have. I’m the type of person that needs to see what I’m doing; when I’m washing my face I do it in front of the mirror to ensure myself that I'm getting everything off, including that pesky eyeliner that works wonderfully ^_^ Let me tell you that this mirror works!! Yes it does! It passed my steamy shower test because not once did it fog up. This mirror truly lives up to its name! AMAZING!<br /><br />TIP: DO NOT clean the product with Windex or any other cleaning product because this wipes off the fogless technologyfrom the mirror!
  14. This definitely fogs in the shower.. I think there might be a way for it to not fog, but it is too much work. If I really need to use it as a mirror, I could run it through the shower to warm it up. It is still there because I don't know how to removed the fixtures. Maybe I should start taking cold showers. Maybe not.
  15. First of all I do like this mirror more than others I have bought but I also agree with other reviewers that it is not fogless as advertised. After I rinsed it with water for the first time, it fogs every time I use it and has to be rinsed several times during shaving. I do not take a hot shower where it steams the shower up.
  16. Disappointing. Didn't last very long as far as the &#34;Fogless&#34; claim.

  48. Edited, since it started fogging after two months. I was initially impressed! But the mirror began fogging routinely after two months. I cleaned it with water only but that did not help. I decided to try the ToiletTree fogless mirror (linked below) instead. There's a small tank behind the mirror that you fill with shower water, which keeps the mirror at roughly the same temperature as the shower. This should prevent fogging. I will review that separately after a month of use. [[ASIN:B003BQ6QXK Fogless Shower Mirror with Squeegee by ToiletTree Products. Guaranteed Not to Fog, Designed Not to Fall. #1 Selling and Ranked by Amazon Customers. (Silver)]] Uninstalling this mirror was a bit of a task since it uses hooks intended to be permanent. I took a Q-tip and liberally applied Goo Gone around all four corners of both hooks. There was a slight gap between the razor hook and my shower wall, so I was able to really soak some Goo Gone into the adhesive sticker through that gap. After about five minutes, I peeled it up from the bottom, using the razor hook itself for leverage. It left very little residue and I used a bit more Goo Gone to finish it off. The mirror hook was more difficult. I installed it better originally, so there wasn't any obvious gap between the adhesive sticker and the shower wall. I still used Goo Gone, but then I had to wedge a putty knife under it and pry it up. The hook itself pried off fairly easily, but it left almost the entire adhesive sticker behind on the wall. With the hook gone, though, I was able to smear lots of Goo Gone on the adhesive, which helped. I used my putty knife to scrape off much of the residue, and then I grabbed a Mr. Clean Magic Eraser to finish the job. I cleaned the entire area with rubbing alcohol and installed my ToiletTree mirror in place of this foggy one.

  61. Those that know me know I used to be horrible about shaving. Seriously, it was bad. So bad that when I finally did shave I would destroy a razor after one use. Cutting through weeks of bristle is a task too tough for most razors. One of the reasons for my slacking was the difficulty of shaving. I had to get out of the shower, get in front of the steam covered mirror. If I shave right away then the mirror is all fogged up and I’m getting cold while drip drying. If I wait until I am the mirror are dry my face is also dry and painful to shave. The trick was to shave in the shower, but that makes mirrors fog up that much quicker.<br />Enter the Cassani Fogless Shower Mirror.<br /><br />This thing has been wonderful. I look forward to shaving now.<br /><br />Of course the product lives up to its name. Its so clear it actually startled me to use it. Hey, who the hell is in the shower with me? Oh, that is my face. I’m not sued to seeing it while in the shower. I used the product according to directions and my face has never been clearer.<br /><br />First of all, attach this to the opposite wall than the shower head. It doesn’t really make sense any other place but people are weird and might mess this up. I would also recommend attaching the shaving razor holder right next to it. The hooks attach easily and are stronger than anything else I’ve ever put up in there, including the shower rod. Also, I’ve found that the razors pick up a bit of moisture while hanging there thus reducing friction while shaving.<br /><br />Remember to use the mirror as directed. Take the covering off. Hang up properly. Do clean it every so often according to directions. A little bit of film built up from the usual shower use and splashes. A quick cleaning and my Cassani Fogless Shower Mirror was perfect once again.<br /><br />Its not suggested on the packaging, but don’t be afraid to take the mirror down and hold it in your hand while shaving. Thanks to the clear reflection I was able to get all parts of my face that I have a habit of missing. No more embarrassing moments, finding out that I’ve missed a huge spot right by the ear.<br /><br />I love this product and plan on having a Cassani Fogless Shower Mirror as a permanent addition to all showers.<br /><br />(This product was provided free for review.)

So, eventually half of mirror became a clear plastic plate! Then I was in need of fog less mirror again. I’m sure there is a special chemical is used, but it really works well.<br />You bring your shower head closer to mirror surface and give some steams. No change.   121. Worked well for two days, but on the third (this morning) it was no longer fogless. And it is not a big deal to shave one handed, holding the mirror in the other, and drenching it periodically to remove built up fog. While I wish it had stayed fogless, and that it had cost less, I'm not sorry I tried it since I can still make it work.

  123. It stays fogless for the first 10 minutes of a shower or so (depends on how long you like to shower). If you get to close to it and breathe on it while you are shaving, it fogs up pretty fast. This can be remedied by just wiping it off with your hand. Even if your hand is wet, it seems to reactivate the anti-fog technology. I will keep using it because it keeps my sink clear of hair and shaving cream, but its not flawless as advertised. I just expected more.

  125. I don't usually write reviews but I felt compelled to share my experience with this product. I use this in the shower to shave my head and I'm 6'4&#34; so I naturally had to hang this mirror quite high. It is on the side of the shower stall about 6'2&#34; above the bottom of the tub and 30&#34; from the shower head. It worked great at first but after a while it started 'peeling' and eventually the coating peeled off and it became just another reflective piece of plastic. I can only surmise that the reason it peeled was because when it got splashed with water, I used my finger to 'squeegee' it and my finger still had traces of soap and/or conditioner (used for shaving) which reacted negatively with the coating. If this is actually the case, I suggest that the coating on this product is far too fragile. I will be searching for another solution besides this product.

This one develops water break (the water clings to its surface in large pools) and it's really hard to see. To be fair, I've experienced this with other &#34;fogless&#34; mirrors, so it may just be the chemical. My advice: just stick to a normal handheld mirror and run it under the water if it fogs up.

  199. Here is a tip for people purchasing this mirror and finding that it's a bit hazy and fogs up immediately (I've seen a few reviews stating this). Remove the protective reflective coating that covers the actual mirror surface. It took me about a week to figure this out. It's applied smoothly with no wrinkling or air bubbles, fits the mirror surface perfectly evenly and has a reflective surface, so it's not nearly as obvious as you'd think. There was a sticker that stated &#34;Please remove&#34;. That's good thinking. However, placing it on the *back* of the mirror that goes against the shower wall instead of on the front on top of the actual protective coating that needs to be removed was not the best in package engineering. Now that the mirror is protective coating free it works great. And a good value for the price.

  247. I have been shaving in the shower for over 40 years (the only way to go IMO), thus having owned dozens of shaving mirrors. None had the features that this one does. It is perfect, leaving nothing wanting. Here is why:<br /><br />Pros:<br />excellent size for seeing your face<br />excellent brilliance to the mirror itself<br />hanging hole is perfect for using a Command Hook or the hook furnished, allowing easy placement and removal<br />un-fogs quicker, better than any mirror in have tried in 40 years!<br />so light and thin that you can travel with it -- just bring a tiny suction cup<br /><br />Cons: None, other than I wish it had been invented 40 years ago!<br /><br />Hints:<br />1. do not listen to anyone who complains about fogging. Simply take the mirror and run it under the shower water for a few second, especially on the back side, and it will quickly normalize the temperature and prevent fogging. If your shower wall is cold and it fogs again, it takes 5 seconds to spray the mirror again and re-hang it. No bit deal, I promise, since the hanging hole at the top of the mirror makes removal a 1-second thing.<br /><br />2. I was pleasantly surprised by the strength of the hanger furnished and the razor hanger too. These are both big-time, excellent-sticking items. Please, just use rubbing alcohol to wipe the area to which you will be sticking them -- this is universally true for all sticky items, but nobody seems to follow directions. Just do it, and it you will be able to hang an engine block off of these hooks.<br /><br />3. I used a Command Strip to hang my mirror, just because I wanted the white hook rather than silver that comes with this mirror -- they both work well.<br /><br />You will note that I did not mention price in the review. Don't care. The product is great at any price.

I had to go out and buy one of those suction cup hooks instead. Note: some other reviewers said there's a thin layer of hard-to-see plastic you have to remove before using-- the company must have changed how you remove this because they made it more easy to see and put a note that blatantly says you have to remove the layer of plastic. At first when reading the positive reviews they mentioned that some people missed the step of removing this- now it's virtually possible to miss that step. The mirror it isn't THAT \\"magical.\\" Also, the company will harass you via email to write a 5-star review, so if you do purchase be prepared for a few hounding emails.

  401. I contacted customer service and they not only sent another hook, they even sent another mirror since the first one was chipped and somewhat unsightly. Put up the new hook and mirror three months ago and no problem since then. No fogging at all even though my bathroom is very tiny and fogs up heavily during a shower. I also like the size of the mirror, not too small or too big and does not look tacky.
  402. It steams up pretty quickly.

I try to hold it by the edges only without leaving any fingerprints. Hangs alongside the razor holder (included) which fits my Gillette Mach3 razor pretty well. The water here isn't softened but it's not a particularly hard water to start with, the water tastes bad due to high chlorine issues.<br />I had a real mirror in the shower for 15 years. Couldn't see my reflection but for a 2x2 patch. Kept moving the mirror to defog it. This mirror if it starts to fog up just quickly run it through the shower to change the temperature of the metal to prevent fogging, really easy. I've used it for about 2-3 months and it's all smiles for me. Just like new.

  483. it still gets foggy after awhile
  484. I have always enjoyed shaving in the shower, mainly because of the efficiency, but also because I feel that I get a better shave with the steam and all. The downside to shaving in the shower for me has always been the difficulty in getting my sideburns straight and making sure I didn’t miss anything, so for the last year or two I have been bringing a cheapo (dollar store) hand held plastic mirror in the shower with me which has helped, but, of course it gets all fogged up and needs to be held. I have found the solution to this to simply rinse the mirror under the shower for a second, which not only cleans the surface but also heats the mirror, which eliminates the fog (which is created by significant temp differences between the surface and the shower)... Anyways, I recently came across this highly rated 'fogless' mirror on amazon which claims to be fogless and hangs on the wall. I did a bit of research, read some reviews, and while I still wasn’t entirely clear on how it works, I figured for $15 I would give it a try. Awesome, problems solved. Or so I thought... It arrived yesterday and I was excited to put it to use. The adhesive sticks to just about any surface well, and I like that it comes with an additional razor hanger. The mirror itself is basically just a super basic oval plastic mirror about 2mm thick with a hole in it for hanging. Now how well did it work you might ask? Well, not very well at all... First of all it fogged up almost immediately, and stayed foggy until I took it off the hook and held it under the shower a bit (just like I had always done with the dollar store regular mirror), it then stayed fogless for a few minutes (until it started to cool) and then fogged up again (just like my $1 mirror)... Basically in the end I realized that there isn’t anything special or magic about this mirror. It simply uses the basic science of condensation where it will form when a surface is cooler than the outside environment (your shower), so by simplyheating up the mirror you are eliminating the condensation... That being said, I would probably recommend to a friend to save a few bucks by buying a cheap thin plastic mirror (glass takes longer to heat and has the risk of breaking). Then if they wanted it to hang (a nice feature that I like) they could simply buy a 3m hook (sold everywhere) to stick in their shower, which would provide the same benefits of this mirror... All in all though, at $15 the price isn’t terrible (and not worth returning), but if your expecting more than a basic mirror that hangs in your shower then save your money. On a very positive note though, the seller Cassani Company has excellent customer service and I have already received several emails from them, notifying me the item has shipped, on proper use etc. So kudos to them on that front.
  485. Is it fogless...no. First use mirror fogged up completely.   507. Fogless Shower Mirror - EASY INSTALL - SHATTER PROOF - Includes Razor Hook - Modern - Anti-Fog Nanotechnology - Exclusive To Amazon<br /><br />The Cassani Fogless Shower mirror is oval and measures 7.5 x 5.7 x 0.1 inches, it comes with two different hooks, mirror, and instructions. Please read the instructions before you begin to unpack your mirror as it contains pertinent information on installation.<br />Decide where you want your mirror, it is preferable to have it out of running water range so it does not obstruct your view by water splashing on it, although keep it nearer to the shower head. This may require you to stand in your tub to find the perfect height. Once you do clean the area well wipe dry and use rubbing alcohol to clean the surface and apply the first hook, it is the one with only one hook on it. Remove backing and apply the hook to the wall for at least 45 seconds.<br /><br />Do not remove the covering from the mirror yet, but set it on the hook and find a place to put the second hook which will hold your razor that is why there are two hooks on it. We have found you can put your razor on it across or hang the head through it leaving the metal blades inward or outward whichever you prefer. Again follow the above instructions on how to hand the second hook same as the first. Allow both to adhere for a couple hours, then remove the covering from the mirror and hang it on the first hook, and the razor in the second.<br /><br />Now you are ready for your shaving experience with your new Fogless Shower Mirror. Cleaning the mirror is not difficult, but do not using cleaning supplies. You can rinse it with water and use your hand to wipe of excess water, or use water and vinegar 50/50 doing the same process by wiping it off with your hand. Cleaning supplies and rubbing it with a towel or cloth will scratch your mirror. These do not last forever and will need to be replaced, but if you take care and follow the instructions you will get your moneys worth out of your product.<br /><br />I am pleased with this purchase, it also gave use some family time installing the mirror as everyone wanted to try it out. *This review is my 100% honest opinion, I have received this product for testing purposes at a reduced rate or free.<br />I recommend this product for everyone that shaves in the shower and tired of fogged up mirrors, or hair in the sink.ut of your product.<br /><br />I am pleased with this purchase, it also gave use some family time installing the mirror as everyone wanted to try it out. *This review is my 100% honest opinion, I have received this product for testing purposes at a reduced rate or free.<br />I recommend this product for everyone that shaves in the shower and tired of fogged up mirrors, or hair in the sink.

  577. &#60;a href=&#34;http://www.tomoson.com/?code=TOP58e067f51724bee745ede55192054eee&#34; rel=&#34;nofollow&#34;&#62;&#60;img style=&#34;display: none&#34; src=&#34;http://www.tomoson.com/images/front/pixel.png&#34; &#62;&lt;/a><br /><br />I had the chance to try this mirror out and at first I thought it was pretty bad, I was expecting a mirror with a suction cup mount, something ready to hang, then this mirror arrived and it uses an adhesive hook (see picture) to mount it to the wall. With the hook method they use it's pretty secure and doesn't move at all. You do have to peel off some paper from the back of the mirror and a plastic sheet from the front, not a big deal. It also comes with an adhesive hook perfect for holding your razor. I use the Dollar Shave club 4 blade razor and you can see in the pic it holds it perfectly. The mirror actually worked really well. Water just falls off of it and it did not fog at all even when taking a very hot shower. After using this I would definitely recommend it.   585. The Cassani mirror is incredibly easy to hang. You simply decide where you want the mirror to go, remove the backing from the included hanger and press firmly. It can be removed from the hanger and put back in seconds, allowing you the freedom of using it for other things if desired. I hung this under the shower head so it is out of the direct spray as suggested, but still in a perfect place for shaving needs. It has held up as claimed and remained fog free every time. The instructions do tell you that for extra long showers, you may need to lightly rinse to remove any cloudiness, but this has not been an issue at all for us.<br /><br />I love that this can be easily removed if we no longer want it there, yet it stays put nicely for as long as we do. Helps with water spots. The permanent hanging hook means that the shaving mirror is not moveable...you have to either leave it home or buy a separate suction hook to hold it in a motel bathroom. no big deal I guess? Super strong mounts for mirror and razor hook. Sharp looking. I love it. I mean i absolutely love it.<br /><br />The so so: when I first used it, it stayed fog free for a whole long shower.The second time I used it, it fogged up quickly, but as I stated above, if you rinse it it stays defogged for a long time. And my routine accommodates this, because I always shave towards the end of the shower when my facial hair is all warm and soft. So I let it fog up, I do everything else I have to do, and just before im about to shave, i run it under the water for a split second and I'm good to go.<br /><br />Technically, this means it's not 100% fog free; but it is a beautiful mirror and super sharp and crystal-clear, and is indescribably better then any non-fog free mirror I've ever jerryrigged my shower before.<br /><br />Note: although I didn't notice this at first because you can't see it when looking at the mirror from shaving distances, from far away on the top left side there is a defect in the mirror; a concavity almost as if a golf ball was pressed on the mirror when was formed. A super shallow concavity about that size. Again, from shaving distances this defect is absolutely invisible; imperceptible. so once again, for the price, and considering the overall quality, it doesn't bother me at all.<br /><br />So for these reasons, I gave it four stars; but I like it so much I am actually fighting back giving itfive stars.

  689. I’m a BuView.com participant & receive sample products from various companies to try, share and then give my honest and own opinion about the product(s) I received. #ReviewsThatBuzz 1) What did you most like/dislike about the product? Like: Lightweight, easy to handle/hold/hang, good shape and size for utilization in the shower for shaving or face cleansing. Dislike: Very thin, backing material appears to be wafer thin adhesive like paper. Mirror reflective surface is delicate. It scratches very easy during normal cleaning (remove water-spots/soap). I even used a soft, non-bristle, cloth, yet it still left visible non removable marks on the reflective surface. 2) What do you think about the overall quality & usefulness of the product? Quality: Fair overall; Even though it is shatter proof the thickness is quite thin that if its accidentally stepped upon at an angle its possible it will break in half. Usefulness: Good: For the intended purpose of this product it is nice and handy in the shower. We're able to preform the necessary personal grooming within half the time it would take if needing to preform these at the bathroom sink. As well on the plus side, when better half shaves in the shower now, my bathroom surfaces have a significant reduction of left behind little stubble/whisker hairs on all my porcelain surfaces. NOTE: I found for this mirror to be at its fullest effectiveness,the front reflective surface (& back) of the mirror must be completely saturated with water in order for the mirror to stay 90% Fog-free. 3) Could you suggest possible improvements to the product? a) Making it a little thicker. I understand it's thin to help eliminate the fog on the surface of the mirror. But those of us with children, would more than likely agree, to prevent little ones from the temptation of &#34;trying to break it&#34; the thickness could be increased a little more. b) Include a glass cleaning cloth to help prevent scratches on the mirrors surface. 4) Would you buy the product? YES 5) Would you recommend it to others? YES 6) Please score it between 1 and 10. 7.5

  709. It appears many use this mirror to shave but I actually use it when cutting my hair in the bathtub. I suppose if one were to shave with it one would place the mirror towards one end of the bathtub, but cutting one's own hair requires some room so the mirror is placed in the center of the tub. This placement was problematic with other mirrors I've tried because I'd occasionally knock them out of place while taking a shower, eventually breaking the mirror and damaging the tub. But this mirror is super low profile - it is frameless and sits maybe 1mm away from the wall, just enough to allow the air to circulate and dry the tile after a shower. It's ingenious!<br /><br />The clarity of the mirror itself is also impressive. While it does not appear to be a &#34;normal&#34; mirror made of glass (so it's neither heavy nor does it feel like it will break easy), it maintains a clarity better than any other bath mirror I've tried - there is no warpage of the reflection nor any distortion. It does appear to have a slightly magnifying effect, and on the first usage (before any water touched it) it appeared to have a slight honeycomb-like distortion pattern that eventually went away.<br /><br />The backing of the mirror appears to be a brown paper-like material so I was a bit concerned of soakage or a mildew build-up. It hasn't had any problems so far, and each time I check during the day it's completely dry.<br /><br />The one concern I have, like many others have also expressed here, is that I live in a rental apartment and that removing the mirror upon my moving out of the apartment may damage the tile upon which the mirror hook is glued. The vendor assures us the adhesive can be removed without damaging the surface so I'll take their word for it for now. Or I may just decide to leave the mirror for the next tenant - I'm sure they won't complain.
  710. i bought some of the other ones on here but this one is the best one i have found, comes with a hook for the mirror which is peel and bond thus very easy to install. and also had a razor hook!<br /><br />unit takes very little space in my shower and offers a good amount of mirror space, i can see my whole face on it while shaving. i bought one for both bathrooms in my home!

You can just pull this one right off the hanger to rinse it off or even store it on a shelf between showers. Good design.

  830. Why shave in the shower instead of outside?<br /><br />There are several benefits -- the first is that the steam from the shower will actually make it easier for you to shave. The steam keeps your pores open and simultaneously softens your skin, which gives a nice, closer shave. You won't have to be plagued by razor burn! Second, being in the shower keeps the razor free of hair and warm, which is especially great if you don't use shaving cream (though I don't know anyone who doesn't!). The next benefit is the fact that, since you are in the shower already, you won't be leaving behind a messy sink for your girlfriend/sister/daughter to have to clean up afterwards. I hate having to take a wash cloth and clean out the sink when I didn't make the mess -- it is definitely a girl pet peeve! Any way you look at it, the Fogless Shower Mirror makes for a better and more enjoyable shave. I don't think any guy could say no! It is also a permanent place to keep your razor, so you never have to worry about misplacing it.<br /><br />My boyfriend &#34;installed&#34; The Cassani Company Fogless Shower Mirror while I took pictures. He gives it a five-star rating. He says that it is nice to be able to stay in the warm shower (especially now that it is getting colder outside) to shave. He loves not having to get out and wait for the mirror in our bathroom to de-fog. We typically have to open the window in the bathroom to get some air flow in order to start the de-fogging process. He says that he has definitely noticed an improvement in how close his shaving is since using the Fogless Shower Mirror. He says that his skin feels softer and he tends to have less razor burn, but also that he just takes more time shaving since he gets to stay in the shower to do it! I think its a great idea, because I couldn't imagine getting out of the shower to shave my legs. I tried once and I ended up with a ton of red bumps -- my skin really needs the constant hydration from the steam to stay soft. Myboyfriend really has no complaints with the Fogless Shower Mirror -- he says that the width is just about perfect, and that it really stays fogless as advertised. He likes having a place for his razor, and the fact that the adhesive is so strong. We both had our doubts with how well it would stick, but luckily, it has held up for about two or three weeks now with no problem. It is not too small for shaving, but it is also not too large so as to &#34;junk&#34; up the shower, if you are worried about that. We think that it would work well in any size shower.
  831. I searched around for a fogless mirror and after a bit of trial and error I settled on the Cassani. It is a lightweight plastic mirror with a lens-type coating on one side, treated for fogless capability. Installation is pretty much idiot-proof, just stick the hook to wall and hang it up. Cassani recommends putting the mirror under the warm shower water to equalize the temperature between the mirror and surroundings. I tried that, works fine, but the mirror seems to not need this step - does not fog up at this time, regardless. Perhaps as the coating wears off, that recommended step will become more necessary.<br /><br />Mirror does not have a magnification factor, simply hangs on the wall. At this price, I think its a great deal and would highly recommend to anyone looking for a shower mirror.

The wall adhesive is very powerful, so if you are going to mount it, make sure to choose a final place for it, because it will not move at all (thankfully!).<br /><br />I am very happy with this product and definitely recommend it to anyone who wants to a mirror that is finally fogless, easy to use, great wall adhesive, and saves a whole lot of time!

The mirror hangs on this well and I know that I will be able to remove the hook without anything left behind.<br /><br />If you frequently use a mirror in the shower or think that you may be interested in doing so....this is the mirror that I would recommend! The same rule kind of applies here - the pores are more open so hair is easier to remove. It's less painful and I can get the really difficult itty bitty new growth much better.<br /><br />The mirror is an inexpensive, simple home product. It's not high end, not fancy. It does what it's designed to do and does it simply. I mounted my mirror to the glass wall of my shower because I figured it might be easier to remove if I had to take it down. We have a 10-year-old fiberglass shower and my experience with sticky stuff and fiberglass is that things stick REALLY well. So basically, my fear is that it'll be permanent and perhaps less so on the glass. I cleaned the glass well before applying the stickered mirror hook and found everything installed quickly and easily. It took 30 seconds. Super fast.<br /><br />This is a very convenient mirror to have in the shower. It's the right size for face shaving, for guys - or for eyebrow plucking for women, and it's lightweight so I'm not worried about it falling off the shower wall.<br /><br />So I like this mirror. It does what it's supposed to do. I docked it by one star because it feels a bit cheap, which does leave me wondering how long it will last.<br /><br />2016 UPDATE: I really liked having this mirror in the shower. My husband also liked it because he could shave in the shower, which means less mess clogging the sink. Unfortunately, despite following the instructions and being incredibly careful to protect the film that keeps the mirror from fogging, it did start fogging in less than a year and was totally unusable shortly after that. I really did like it but it's not a long-term solution.

  939. &lt;a href=\\"http://www.tomoson.com/?code=TOPaf1c0126de157835dfcf103e83bbe29a\\" rel=\\"nofollow\\">&lt;/a><br /><br />I have put my Cassani Fogless Mirror to use! I read the instructions and did not use any harsh detergents or cleaning products to remove the label. Just hot water. I returned it today 10 Feb 2014.<br /><br />First, the oval shape is lame, in my opinion. It feels claustrophobic to be staring at my face in a mirror that wraps to the approximate contours of my face. Oval has nothing to do with the human field of vision and it is just a terrible idea, despite the vendor assuring me that their customers overwhelmingly prefer it.<br /><br />Second, you should be aware that any reviews prior to some date between November 21, 2013 and January 28, 2014 are for the previous rectangular mirror, not this oval one.<br /><br />It is my opinion that to change the product as radically as this and still call it the same product, is fundamentally dishonest. They are trafficking on reviews for a product that is no longer the product they sell.<br /><br />My recommendation is to avoid this business and buy one of the Shave Well mirrors:<br />Shave Well Deluxe 6.8 x 5.2 $13<br />[[ASIN:B0085WHBHU Deluxe Shave Well Fog-Free Shower Mirror - #1 Selling Shower Mirror on amazon.com - 33% Larger Than Our Original Shave Well Mirror]]<br /><br />Shave Well original 6.0 x 4.0 $10<br />[[ASIN:B004VFXVJW The Shave Well Company a TRULY FOG FREE Shower Shave Mirror. Truly fogless by design. Will not fall off of the wall.]]<br /><br />It is my belief that this mirror is actually a copy of the Shave Well mirror. The original was rectangular and competed on size. Now, they've changed shape without trumpeting that fact. (As of today the product title is burdensomely long, but never mentions the changed shape: \\"Fogless Shower Mirror - Guaranteed Fog Free - Exclusive to Amazon - No Suction Cups - Designed Not to Fall - Ultra-easy Set up - Includes Additional Razor Wall Mount\\" [[ASIN:B00CNOUZE2 Fogless Shower Mirror - Guaranteed Fog Free - Exclusive to Amazon - No Suction Cups - Designed Not to Fall - Ultra-easy Set up - Includes Additional Razor Wall Mount]] How about \\"Oval Fogless Shower Mirror\\" for an honest product title?<br /><br />I had my misgivings about buying from the copy-cat (see my original review below) and I'm sorry now that I didn't trust my instincts. I originally felt that the larger size was worth the compromise. I'll probably buy the Deluxe Shave Well as the replacement for this one. I'll be sorry it's a little smaller, but c'est la vie. At least it will be rectangular.<br /><br />Unless you purchased the \\"before\\" rectangular mirror and then the \\"after\\" oval mirror you'd never know about this change. Which makes it all the dirtier that they did it. I tried not to update my review, but it seemed unfair for Cassani Company to have my 5-star rating for a different product than I reviewed.<br /><br />Sorry, Michael at Cassani Company, you may be all about communicating with your customers and kudos to you for that, but fundamentally changing the product without notice and trading on older reviews is immoral. In my opinion.<br /><br />------------------------------------------------<br /><br />Original review 20130103:<br />Once there are more than a handful of reviews I'm loathe to leave another one. Why am I leaving a review of this product ([[ASIN:B00CNOUZE2 Fogless Shower Mirror - Guaranteed Fog Free - Exclusive to Amazon - No Suction Cups - Designed Not to Fall - Ultra-easy Set up - Includes Additional Razor Wall Mount]] $15 today 20130103), anyway? I noticed two emails coming from Cassani, the seller of this item. The first email was a follow-up to the purchase, providing information in case the mirror had not arrived. The second was a request for a review, saying that they are a small brand on Amazon and 5-star reviews can help a lot. It is in fact an excellent mirror, worthy of 5 stars, so okay here's a 5-star review. And while I'm at it, I'll try to satisfy other comparison shoppers like me.<br /><br />I've been shaving in the shower for at least a couple of decades and never had a shower mirror before. For some reason, last November I decided to look for one. (Actually, now that I think of it, the reason was that I've been doing such a careless job of shaving lately that I thought a mirror might help me break my bad-shaving habit.)<br /><br />The last time I paid any attention to fogless in-shower mirrors, the state of the art was mirrors that installed between the shower head and the water pipe in order to circulate hot water behind the mirror. Apparently sometime during my Rip Van Winkle phase, somebody figured out that a light-weight mirror could be non-fogging by dint of its low mass which allows it to quickly adjust to shower temperatures. That seemed like a good idea, didn't require messing with the plumbing or lowering the showerhead and was inexpensive, so I went for it.<br /><br />Guessing from what I've read on Amazon, a company called Shave Well pioneered this product area, or at least pioneered marketing this product area on Amazon. They offer two sizes of their mirror. The original is rather small. A larger one (the Deluxe model) is a bit bigger: [[ASIN:B0085WHBHU Deluxe Shave Well Fog-Free Shower Mirror - #1 Selling Shower Mirror on amazon.com - 33% Larger Than Our Original Shave Well Mirror]] and is cheaper than this one by a few dollars ($13 vs $16 at this time). I bought the Cassani mirror because it is a bit bigger than the larger Shave Well mirror.<br /><br />The Cassani mirror is excellent and works as advertised. After owning it, I'd say that even the Shave Well original mirror [[ASIN:B004VFXVJW The Shave Well Company a TRULY FOG FREE Shower Shave Mirror. Truly fogless by design. Will not fall off of the wall.]] ($10 at this writing), though quite small, is definitely large enough to do the job. But if I was going to buy another one, I'd buy this one again, because it's a cheap luxury to get one a bit bigger and my shower is big enough to accomodate it without any space considerations.<br /><br />I have two sort-of criticisms about this product, neither of which cause it to lose stars:<br /><br />1) I'm not fond of the glue-strip attachable hooks. The hooks look nice, but I have a fiberglass shower enclosure and don't use glue-on anything in there. I've been hanging my razor from a suction-cup hook and I bought another one for a couple of bucks from Target. It holds the mirror just fine. It would be great if Cassani packaged this mirror with glue-on and suction cup hooks, or offered it packaged either way, but no doubt that would probably increase costs and complexity to make it relatively untenable. (Note that the Shave Well mirrors also come with adhesive hooks. This Cassani mirror also comes with a hook for your razor.)<br /><br />2) I'm not necessarily a fan of buying a derivative product instead of the original (i.e. Shave Well) but in this case, the derivative product (Cassani) won because of the size. Really, the up-and-coming competitor usually is priced below the original. In this case that's not so, but it is larger and thus seems to be a significant enough improvement that I preferred it over the original. (BTW, I could be totally wrong about who came first in the marketplace, so take this info with several grains of salt.)<br /><br />Here's the upshot - compare these mirrors on size and price and buy the one that meets your size and budget strategy:<br /><br />Cassini 7.5 x 5.7 $15<br />Shave Well Deluxe 6.8 x 5.2 $13<br />Shave Well original 6.0 x 4.0 $10<br /><br />N.B.:<br /><br />While writing this review I went into the shower to check the mirror out and found<br />that it has been damaged sometime between my morning shower and now. Oops. It's not the mirror's fault though. I've had it for 6+ weeks and it has shown no visiblewear and tear. But today, my housekeepers showed up and apparently decided they would use the shower-cleaning product on it, even though it was perfectly clean in the first place.<br /><br />I don't know what they used, but it seems to have taken all the joy out of the nice clear surface. I just spent 15 minutes trying to clean it with plain water, then with soap and then with toothpaste, with varying results each time. It has not returned to normal. I guess I'll live with it for a bit and maybe make another attempt or two to fix it. If those fail, I'll buy another. No point having the first one in there reminding me every morning of what a nice mirror it used to be.

  979. Finally! A mirror that works!<br />I love this mirror! I am not a guy, I am a lady. A lady with nearly waist length hair. A lady who shaves her underarms. A lady who likes to do spa facial masks and wash them off in the shower. A lady who likes to take off her makeup in the shower.<br />Before I had this mirror, I would bring some awful-yet-cheap mirror into the shower. I would pray that it would not break if it was a regular glass mirror, or I would pray that it would not fog up. Plastic mirrors are horrible, generally speaking. I do from time to time get contacted by companies and provide opinions about their product and they either gift me the product or give it to me very deeply discounted. I got this for free. Check out my reviews. I don't always give a free product a high rating. If I like it, I like it, but if not, I am honest about it.<br />Back to the review. When I got this mirror, I was really impressed with the packaging. Cassani did an excellent job. From the outer box, the mirror is secured within so that there is no movement. The back of the mirror has a light brown paper that is easily removed. The front has a clear film. Remove both of those, and you are ready to go.<br />I chose not to use the adhesive hooks because I am going to be moving in the next couple of months. That did not stop me, however. There is a 3/4 inch hole at the top of the mirror. I ran a shoestring through that, knotted it and looped it over the shower head. Perfection. It is exactly the right height.<br />Now about the mirror. This thing is incredible. NO, really, incredible. They need to re-label the packaging and add the phrase HD to it. Reflection quality is excellent. The image of the cheeky smiling guy on the box is not as clear as the reflection you will see in the mirror. It is amazing.<br />I chose to go into the shower for testing purposes with the following issues in place (Thank goodness for endless hot water!)<br />I had an avacado oil and coffee mask on my hair. I had a matcha green tea mask on my face. I needed to shave. I had waterproof mascara on. Does this sound like the perfect storm to see if my mirror could handle it? Well, it sure was!<br />When you do anything weird to your hair, you have to keep looking down to see if the water is running clear. That is great if you get to that point, but if you still have product in your hair, you don't know what part of your hair is still affected! Crazy. With the mirror, I was able to see exactly where I needed to rinse better.<br />The green tea mask. This will make you look like the incredible hulk. Little bits of the mask always seem to get into my hairline, and I discover them when I am drying my hair. Not awesome. Well, no more! Why? Because I was able to thoroughly rinse my face off. I was able to see those little bits of mask and apply more cleanser and scrub well.<br />Waterproof mascara. I love and hate mascara. I love how pretty it makes my eyelashes. I love how it makes me feel pretty. I hate having to get this stuff off. It is a pain. You cleanse, then you look up. still mascara. You repeat. At the sink, this can be messy, with water everywhere. In the shower, it is a lot of guesswork. Not anymore. Saturate a cotton pad with your eye makeup remover, wipe each eye. Check it out in the mirror. Repeat as needed. Done.<br />Shaving underarms. If you don't shave your underarms, you are lucky. I, however, do. Armpits are at a location where humans can't look at them for long without having eyestrain. Ha! That is no longer a problem! I was able to get this done, check it out and I was not worried about nicking myself.<br />My shower mirror is really a welcome product addition. I know that when I color my hair next, I will be using it to get all of the color out. I know that when I come back from a costume party, I will not have to worry about cleaning all of the costume makeup out of the sink. Just like the ad copy says, this mirror is truly fogless. Trust me. I run a hot shower. When I come out, the mirror at the vanity is always fogged up. This mirror never even got &#34;edge fog&#34;, where the edges begin to get steamy. Nothing. Believe me, I was ready for it to happen, but it never did!<br />The mirror is made of a lightweight material. The two hangers that are provided are brushed metal. For cleaning. I will be using a damp cloth and wiping it gently. If you have any questions, feel free to ask me, because I really like this mirror a lot!ower.   1045. The main reason why it is still in my shower is the fact that I do need a mirror and I like not having to worry about shattering a regular mirror as this mirror is certainly not fogless! It worked for some time but now fogs every time I use a shower. You have to pour water over it to get it to un-fog, just like with a regular mirror. But, as I said, it is still better than having a real mirror in your shower!
  1046. It stayed fogless for 2-3 days and then stopped working. I have to keep washing the mirror, at least 5-6 times during shower to shave. It is taking me longer than before to shave and I'm also wasting alot of water during shower. I'm not happy at all.
  1047. Has worked wonders and has not steamed up at all. It also looks very appealing and has a bit of a modern feel to it. I would recommend this to other people.
  1048. the sticker on the mirror was very difficult to remove. I ended up scratching the mirror getting it off. It was a nightmare.

  1051. Works much better than other products, even though the price difference is insignificant. This mirror is truly fogless (due to the magic, fog-absorbing coating, I guess) and you need not remove it from the shower wall and warm it under the water for it to work. It is a superior product, but don't let anyone 'clean' it with Windex, because that will ruin the fogless coating.

  1054. This is the best shaving mirror for the shower I have ever purchased. Its always clear and clean, with a simple wash with water. The mirror is crisp and clear. I highly recommend this mirror.
  1055. The installation of this mirror was painless ; all I had to do was clean my shower wall, make sure the surface was dry, peel and stick the wall mounts, place them and then hang the mirror and put our razor in it's new resting place. After installation I was ready to try this mirror out and see if it lived up to its claims. I got into the shower and turned my water up as hot as possible. I waited until I got a nice steam going then peeled back my shower curtain and peeked at my other two bathroom mirrors, both of which were fogged up. The Cassani mirror however, was not. It remained crystal clear and I could see my reflection perfectly. I used it to make sure I got all of the makeup residue off of my face and to pop a couple of black heads. I don't have a mustache or beard therefore I don't shave my face so I invited my husband to try shaving in the mirror in the shower. He came out cleanly shaven and couldn't believe that the mirror didn't fog up! After everything is said and done this mirror does exactly what it claims to do, doesn't fog up and makes shaving a pleasant experience!
  1056. I've had two other brands and this is by far my favorite. It doesn't fog and if it gets too much water on it (because I mounted mine too close to the shower stream) it rinses very easily. I can't imagine why this would ever have to be replaced.
  1057. Out of the box it was fantastic; just hang it up and it works. Except one day (the heat was off, the mirror was cold and it got a bit too steamy) I had to run hot water over it to heat it up and since then every time I MUST run hot water over it or it will fog up.<br /><br />I really want to give it 3.5 star, but ...
  1058. I was a little skeptical about this mirror at first because it was such a great price. I thought it would be made of cheap plastic and was worried it wouldn't last long. It's been nearly two months and it has worked better than any other shower mirror we've ever had. I'm so glad he can shave in the shower again and not leave a mess in and around the sink!
  1059. I hung this mirror eye level and during the first use the thing got wet b/c the water was bouncing off my face and shoulders and spraying/splashing the mirror. Unfortunately water turns the the anti fog coating into a bumpy mess of goo which makes for more distortions than a fun house mirror. I guess this *shower mirror* can't get wet. Kinda defeats the purpose of a shower mirror. This thing is a gimmick and probably should only be sold on late night infomercials.
  1060. I recently had the chance to try the Cassani Fogless Shower Mirror thanks to the folks at Cassani. I got it through Amazon.com, and it was here a couple of days after ordering thanks to Amazon Prime. Using patented nanotechnology infused directly into the reflective surface of the mirror, it purports to let you focus on the shave and not the mirror. While at first that was the case, I'll admit that by use 2 it was a gummy mess. The nanotechnology is actually a coating that when wet turns kind of, well...slimey. While the stainless steel hook looks pretty snazzy, and when left to air dry the mirror does too, at $15 I'm not too sure I'd buy it. Especially when you consider it's not glass, it's plastic.<br /><br />Therein lies the second problem. I'm certain it was just the one shipped to us, but the one we received was slightly &#34;warped&#34;, leaving it not optically correct and closer to a fun house mirror. Which hubby pronounced to be quite distracting during his shave. So while the upside is that a glass mirror would most certainly have been shattered, the downside is, plastic bends instead of breaking.<br /><br />So, fogless? Check! Shatterproof? Check! It is large, mostly clear, and comes with mountable brushed steel hooks for the mirror and your razor. And hubby has decided shaving in the shower is better, cleaner and quicker than shaving in the sink. The downside is it gets wet in the shower, turns gummy, and is kind of expensive for a piece of oval plastic. I'll let you decide if the convenience is worth the potential drawbacks. I do like that the company stands by their products and offer a 100% Money Back Guarantee. You just don't get that from companies anymore!<br /><br />I received the above product(s) free of charge from Cassani. I am not obligated to provide a positive or favorable review, just my honest opinion. My review is based on my experience with the product and/or brand, which may differ from yours.

  1063. I’ve been using various “fogless” mirrors for years to shave in the shower. They worked fine in the beginning, but they all failed within a year or two. I resigned to the fact that I would have to replace the shower mirror every few years. Since I needed a new one, I thought I would research my options. After much research, weighing positives and negatives, I went with this one.<br /><br />It was perfect (no fog or condensation) right after I bought it (summer), but condensation now appears with every shower (fall). I’m chalking this up to the temperature changes—cold mirror now gets hit with hot, humid air. With my already warm, wet hand, (i.e., pliable, smooth skin) I lightly wipe off the condensation as soon as it appears, and the mirror is clear for the rest of my shower (about 20 minutes). No fog while shaving, which is why I bought it.<br /><br />Easy install, nice dimensions for shower (I hate unneeded extra space--i.e., square shape), and good customer service; the company emailed me a few times after the purchase to make sure everything was fine. The company seems very concerned about getting this correct. So refreshing!

  1140. Just so you know this is a BIG shave mirror. Even someone with bad eyes like me can see my ugly mug with this one.<br /><br />Note that the mounting hook is a permanent, stick on type. Make sure you follow the instructions on installation. I would have preferred a suction cup type as I use my shaving mirror during travel and would like to mount it to the shower in the hotel. In this case I am SOL.<br /><br />Also, although they say this is fog free, that is not totally true. I would say this is really fog resistant but only for a few minutes. You need to preheat/wet the mirror in order to get a few minutes of fog free usage. Just remember to NEVER clean the mirror with any type of cleaning solution or you might lose what little fog resistance there is. I think in time I might try treating it with Rain-X that you use to keep car windows rain and fog free. They don't want this thing getting wet, or anywhere where it might feel the draft of the air outside the shower, so finding the right place to place it is a challenge.   1155. I would like to start out by saying how much I loved this company. When I emailed them I was answered very quickly after. The person I talked to was the company's founder, Michael (no last name was provided). As for the product itself, I loved the concept and it did what it promised. It was completely fogless. It was very simple to attach to my shower and was very well made. I like that the hooks are stainless steel to prevent the from rusting or changing color if they get wet. The mirror itself is very light weight so there is no worry of it being to heavy for the hook. The razor hook is not attached to the mirror so you can put it anywhere you want around the mirror. The thing I do not like about this product is the way it attaches to the shower. The sticky pads feel like you are making a very big commitment and if you want to move the mirror later? Forget about it.I also noticed that on the directions it says do not put the mirror in the direct stream of water. Well, don't put it anywhere near where you will actually be using the shower either. I accidentally splashed a little when I was pulling conditioner through my hair, (it's a shower, it's bound to get a little messy right?) Well now it's ruined! In my attempt to get the conditioner off, I guess the layer that makes it fogless got smudged so now it looks like there is goop or something smudged all over it. Very sad. The mirror is still fogless so I will continue to use it but as for actually wanting to inspect my face? Well, I would just say no man can use it to shave now.

  1209. I recently received Cassani‘s Fogless Shower Mirror in return for my honest review. Initially, I wasn’t sure if I was going to use this, as I am a woman and I do not shave my face!! I decided to hang it on my shower wall and see if I would use it.<br /><br />The mirror is not made of glass, of which I am very happy about – it is plastic, so it if falls down, it won’t shatter into glass pieces. This was very easy to set up ~ I just placed the hook for the mirror where my face height would be in the shower and pressed it into the wall. I do wish they used suction cups as once this is in, it is on the wall until you remove it! The razor hook was a nice addition, as we ladies do shave other body parts as well. The hooks are made of stainless steel, so hopefully, they will not rust. The finish is a brushed steel finish, the mirror is not bulky and does not take up a lot of space. It is very functional and will not clash with any bathroom design, imho.<br /><br />I have found, now that it is hanging in my shower, that I am bringing my tweezers into my shower! This is so handy for me to pluck my eyebrows and any other stray hairs I might find around my face. I also find that this is helpful with my cleansers and pore brush, so I can ensure that I cleanse my face and not miss any spots that need special attention. The mirror, so far, has not fogged up and I’ve been using it for over a week now. It is important to follow the cleaning instructions and not use glass cleaner or any other chemicals. Just use water and a soft cloth to clean ~ otherwise, it will destroy the anti-fogging properties of the mirror.<br /><br />All in all, I am pleasantly surprised at how much I use my mirror in the shower as I never had one before and never thought to add one there. It wasn’t something, as a woman, I felt I needed, as I don’t shave my face.   1259. Let me preface by saying the mirror itself works exactly as advertised - adheres *extremely* well to shower tile and barely fogs even with 20+ minutes of steam.<br /><br />That being said, the idiom &#34;measure twice, cut once&#34; is very important with this product! The mirror is slightly smaller than your head and the mounting unit can't be removed without destroying the adhesive, so take care with placing it exactly where you'll see it best. I accidentally adhered mine ~3 inches below eye level and realized too late that it can`t be removed or repositioned without buying a new mount. Ideally it would use a suction cup, but that would be much less secure so I can't really blame the manufacturer for my own poor planning!<br /><br />If there was a solution for repositioning the mirror without buying an entire new unit, I would gladly raise this review to 5 stars :)
  1260. Mirror looks good.<br />I have hanged on the hook, that was included with the mirror, inside my shower stall.<br />Is it fogless? Nope, but it doesn't matter that much to me.<br />I just warm it up in the shower, hang it on the hook and I have no problem seeing my ugly face.
  1261. After first receiving this I would have given it 5 stars. Two to three months later I would have given it 4 stars. I now give it three stars because it has continually fogged up more, and more quickly as time has passed. It's to the point where I may just throw it away. I've tried cleaning it with a soft towel and soap, toothpaste, and even coated it with shampoo (it worked until it was washed off). I still give it three stars because it worked great for a few months and it wasn't expensive.

  1263. My wife and kids bought this for my birthday last year (the day after Christmas) and I loved it! The reviews alone made me want to open it immediately and have a nice shower and shave. It worked flawlessly for the first month and then began to fog immediately. For the last 2 months I have been showering and staring at my FOG mirror and wondering what happened to it's magical powers. I finally took a picture and decided to post this review. What did I do to mine that no one else did toy theirs? I don't know. I read the cleaning instructions. Never cleaned it. Not once. It needed to be rinsed ONCE. I rinsed it and then... FOG. Can you really not rinse this magical mirror? Is water it's Lex Luthor? I surely hope not. Not for a mirror meant to be used in the shower. Anyway. I got to shave in the shower for a nice 30 days. Now I'm back at the sink remembering the good times I had once upon a time. Just me, my razor, and my once loved Fogless Mirror.

As soon as the mirror fogs up, I need to unhook the mirror and run it under water. This will yield approximately 1-2 minutes of fog-free use. I usually have to run it under water twice to complete my shave. I would have probably returned the mirror if I had not already affixed the hook to the wall. While the mirror easily attaches and detaches from the mounted hook, it certainly does not meet its claim of being a fogless mirror. Thus, the two star review.

The mirror does not fog, even in the hottest shower conditions, and the mirror is a good size for any shower. It is very lightweight and is not made of glass, so it is safe. I turned our shower on and washed my hair, letting the steam from the shower fill the bathroom.<br /><br />The mirror DOES stay fog-free. However, after handling it, it feels cheap and plasticy... The back of the mirror looks to be of pressed board. I'm not 100% sure the hardware (the wall hook and the razor holder) are actually stainless steel, as the company claims. They feel extremely too light to be stainless steel.<br /><br />As far as disabled people using this, I think the HARDEST thing you will encounter is affixing the hardware to the shower wall. If you have a shower caddy with hooks, it MAY be easier to just use one of the hooks on the caddy.<br /><br />I'm sure this would be a great mirror for travelling, like to prop against a dresser for makeup or as a handheld mirror for plucking/tweezing, but as for home use, I'd feel more secure using a mirror with suction cups or a shower caddy with hooks.<br /><br />FINAL THOUGHTS<br />The mirror DOES live up to it's promises, but I would be scared that the adhesive would give way, and I'd have a broken mirror in my bathtub.<br />WOULD RECOMMEND: Probably not.

  1376. I'll admit I bought this because of the all the positive reviews, which is why I'm baffled by what I ended up receiving. Though the mirror definitely stays fog free compared to an average shower mirror, it's become essentially unusable.<br /><br />First, the mirror came out of the box with a strange residue in three spots. It's not sticky, but looks like a thin layer of dried glue. I'm afraid to use a cleaner to remove it for fear of damaging whatever &#34;nanotechnology&#34; film they've applied.<br /><br />But worse than that, after just a week, a fine network of strange &#34;scratches&#34; started to appear, seemingly under the mirror film. The surface itself isn't perceptibly rough, but it seems like the reflective sheet itself has buckled/cracked underneath, like the way a car window will crack into a million pieces from one blow. And then there's another network of even smaller cracks superimposed on that, over only part of the mirror. These cracks are so small that it, ironically, looks like fog. In bright light (like you would use to shave), these cracks make the mirror entirely unusable.<br /><br />And no, I didn't use anything to clean the mirror other than water and a paper towel. I had to go back to the cheap Walmart mirror I was using before - 2.5 years old but at least functional. It's hard to get a good picture of the problem, it's actually worse than it looks in the picture.<br /><br />Needless to say, I'm disappointed with this purchase. Maybe I happened to get a bad one, I really don't know.

  1403. Where has this been all my life? I now spend upwards of 67 minutes in the shower, staring at myself. It has made me late for work on numerous occasions. Ironically this mirror has actually been influential in making me shave less because now I am able to stare at my gorgeous beard in the comfort of my own naked time.<br /><br />Pros:<br />- Nano-technology, fogless feature: I have no idea how this technology works, but they must hide the computer very well. Somehow it prevents it from fogging. It may even be enchanted.<br />- Easy installation: Tying my sneakers was more traumatizing than installing this mirror. This of course is no longer an issue since I now wear shoes with velcro fasteners.<br />- Mounts: Comes with a handy, secondary metal mount for my razor. I have not installed it quite yet, but I can think of at least 11 different things to hang in my shower, including my tooth brush, a golf pencil, nunchucks, or a handy straw.<br />- It hangs in such a way that when I walk into my bathroom, I can actually see it hanging in the shower. It's a very mystical experience... from 10 feet away, the image is somewhat distorted, but the closer I get the more detail it shows. I feel almost as if I am called in by the sirens of my own vanity to see my reflection slowly clear-up until I snap out of it, looking around to see myself standing in the shower, fully clothed. Sometimes I still have the car keys in my hand from walking in the door 2 hours prior.<br /><br />Cons:<br />- The seller (Cassani) keeps emailing me tips, tricks, and FAQs with subjects like &#34;IMPORTANT: How To Protect & Use Your Fogless Shower Mirror.&#34; Evidently mirrors that hang in showers are extremely complicated endeavors and have driven many men to insanity without proper guidance. I appreciate their frequent emails that remind me how to use this advanced technology.<br />- When I asked it, &#34;Who is the fairest of them all?&#34; it just kind of sits there.

I use the mini facial razors from the dollar Japanese store which hang perfectly on the wall mount holder. No more red skin irritation from shaving on dry skin. I have a facial mask obsession and find the mirror convenient when thoroughly rinsing off my face. It will also come in handy when rinsing off hair dye. I can catch any spots I might have missed on my hairline or scalp. Usually I have to step out of the shower dripping water to check out my hairline. All there was to it was putting up the self-adhesive wall mounts and letting them set for a few hours. Easy peasy! The mirror has anti-fog nanotechnology so it never steams up. I can't believe I went all these years without a mirror in my shower!

  1441. There is nothing more annoying than trying to shave in a foggy mirror and I was excited when I purchased the &#34;HIGHEST RATED!&#34; version of this category.<br /><br />I had high hopes based on all the 5 star reviews that this fog free mirror would be different than all the others I have used over the years, but now I realize that an amazon &#34;HIGHEST RATED!&#34; product doesn't automatically mean I will get a great quality product. I wonder how anyone would not be disappointed with this product after using it for a few weeks and call into question most of the reviews. Maybe everyone is just trying to be nice.<br /><br />This product works as advertised for about 3 weeks. The biggest problem with this mirror is that the coating and the face of the mirror is incredibly delicate. It scratches very easily and just the simple act of accidentally touching it with anything will leave tiny scratches. Once the scratches appear, the performance deteriorates rather quickly. After about week 3 it started to fog up and before I used it to shave, I would take it off the hook and just run it under the shower water for a few seconds and then I would get a few minutes of crisp clear fog free reflection. At about week 5 I had to repeat this process several times during the shave and the entire mirror would not be fog free, only a few patches.<br />Now I am at week 6 of using this and what is happening now is that the water does not shed after I rinse it off, it just leaves little water drops all over it making using it nearly impossible.<br /><br />I read the directions that came with the mirror and the additional e-mail that was sent to me and I followed them exactly. I think that due to its fragility, even following the directions leaves no room for the accidental brush up with a wash cloth or inadvertent contact. I think that if you were as careful as the directions say with this mirror with any other fog free mirror, you would probably see the same performance out of a cheaper mirror.<br /><br />Not all was bad, the shape and design of this mirror are great. I love that it hangs from a hook and is lightweight especially since I don't have to worry about it breaking and hurting anyone if it falls off. Plus it is easy to remove in order to run under the shower to get rid of the fog. If I were to review this after the first day I used it, I would easily give it a 5. But I never review a product without putting it through some practical use.<br /><br />I suppose that if you had a way to mount this in such a way where you could guarantee that you would never touch it, it might work better for you but it is just not practical to do that in a normal size shower.<br /><br />Also, If you could reapply the anti-fog coating every 3-4 weeks then that would address this products shortcomings.
  1442. The mirror fogs up after a month of use.
  1443. UPDATED 11/17/2014: I reduced this to two stars after a few more weeks of use.<br /><br />Before even receiving this mirror, I started receiving personalized e-mails from the manufacturer (Cassani). So apparently there is a shower mirror company somewhere in China that now has my full name and e-mail address. Thank you, Amazon!<br /><br />I bought this mirror because it was one of the highest-rated shower mirrors, but quickly found it did not live up to the rave reviews.<br /><br />My shower is a standard tub with a sliding-glass door, so it's pretty well sealed up, other than a couple of feet of open space between the top of the door and the ceiling. The instructions in the e-mail contained conflicting information: \\"By warming the mirror with the shower stream the difference in temperature between the shower air and the mirror disappears.\\" And then, a few sentences later: \\"We recommend you placing your mirror away from areas in the direct shower stream.\\" OK, so I need the mirror to be warmed by the shower stream but it also needs to be be placed away from areas IN said shower stream! Where should I put it - on the ceiling?<br /><br />I ignored the e-mail's advice to do a \\"test run\\" before mounting the mirror permanently. I'm not sure how I would test the mirror mounted in a different place, without actually mounting it! The adhesive mounts provided are a one-shot deal. I ended up mounting it on the far side of the shower, directly opposite the shower head. That was the most convenient spot for me.<br /><br />The mirror itself looks like a shiny adhesive-backed piece of Contact paper mounted to a cheap plastic oval. It is very lightweight. The two metal clips are very thin-gauge, but seem strong enough for the light weight of the mirror and my razor.<br /><br />Surprisingly, the mirror's optical quality is very good. The image is undistorted, focused, and clear - in fact, it's better than some rearview mirrors I've seen in cars. I never realized how great I look in the shower! Unfortunately, after about 30 seconds, my euphoria wore off as the mirror begun to develop ... you guessed it ... FOG! Yes, it's true - the highest-rated \\"fogless\\" mirror on Amazon fogs up like a Chevy Cavalier parked on Makeout Point.<br /><br />It's very simple to quickly rinse the mirror off to remove the fog, but if I wanted to do that, why would I buy a fogless mirror? Anyway, it's fogless condition only persists for about 30 seconds, so it's a race between the fog and my razor. If I ever sever my carotid artery because I'm trying to finish shaving before the mirror fogs over again, there's going to be a lawsuit! Just sayin'.<br /><br />To be fair, I also tried this mirror in my wife's shower using a suction cup mount, and it did the same thing. It doesn't seem to matter where I put it - it fogs up!<br /><br />So to sum up, my chief complaints are:<br />1. This mirror does not live up to its main selling point.<br />2. Why am I getting e-mails from the manufacturer?<br />3. I would prefer suction-cup mounts rather than the semi-permanent adhesive provided.<br /><br />The positives are:<br />1. It was cheap.<br />2. It seems like it will stay in good shape for a long time, despite its relatively inexpensive construction.<br />3. Image quality is good.<br /><br />Don't expect miracles from this thing. You are better off just using any old mirror and rinsing it off while you shave, because that's what you will end up doing with this one!about 30 seconds, my euphoria wore off as the mirror begun to develop ... you guessed it ... FOG! Yes, it's true - the highest-rated \\"fogless\\" mirror on Amazon fogs up like a Chevy Cavalier parked on Makeout Point. It's very simple to quickly rinse the mirror off to remove the fog, but if I wanted to do that, why would I buy a fogless mirror? Anyway, it's fogless condition only persists for about 30 seconds, so it's a race between the fog and my razor. If I ever sever my carotid artery because I'm trying to finish shaving before the mirror fogs over again, there's going to be a lawsuit! Just sayin'. To be fair, I also tried this mirror in my wife's shower using a suction cup mount, and it did the same thing. It doesn't seem to matter where I put it - it fogs up! So to sum up, my chief complaints are: 1. This mirror does not live up to its main selling point. 2. Why am I getting e-mails from the manufacturer? 3. I would prefer suction-cup mounts rather than the semi-permanent adhesive provided. The positives are: 1. It was cheap. 2. It seems like it will stay in good shape for a long time, despite its relatively inexpensive construction. 3. Image quality is good. Don't expect miracles from this thing. You are better off just using any old mirror and rinsing it off while you shave, because that's what you will end up doing with this one!

  1465. Mirror works as intended mirror does fog up a little bit at first but as the directions state you should run it under the shower for a few seconds to warm it up. Any cold mirror or glass collects the warm condensation. The mounting although somewhat permanent is small enough to clean around. I like it its way better than my old suction cup mirror that continuously fogged up and fell off the wall in the middle of the night and startled me awake. Sometimes simpler is better.
  1466. fantastic mirror, doesnt fog at all!
  1467. I have never reviewed a product but since the company sent me an email asking for one, here you go. I followed the directions, placed the mirror in the shower \\"away from\\" the water stream. It has never been cleaned with anything, nor wiped off with anything. I got maybe 3 or 4 showers with it before it started fogging up. If I give it a quick rinse, I can use it. But that's not why I bought it in the first place. It's certainly not \\"fogless\\".
