  1484. So I ordered this mirror a month ago. And I was giving it time to see if it lived up to expectations. And lo and behold..<br /><br />..it doesn't.<br /><br />The first tip-off to the quality of this mirror was the fact that it used buzzwords: &#34;nanotechnology&#34;. Words like that makes things sound all future-y and more advanced. Ooh. Aah. Already it made me wary when I heard it being used for such an item, but the reviews seemed good enough, so I went for it.<br /><br />After setting up the mirror, it was fog-free for a week and a half or so until I noticed it was starting to be..'hazy' in the steam, but not quite steamed up, and I wasn't sure if it was my eyes or it was losing its anti-fog properties. However, now, after about say 28 or 29 days later, it fogs up like any normal mirror, and I have to rinse it with water to get the steam off.<br /><br />And of course, the sheet of water over the glass protects it from further fogging for a bit. So it's basically like any other mirror at this point.<br /><br />The next time you hear of a common- or pesudo-common household item using buzzwords, do indeed be wary.<br /><br />It gets two stars for being fog-free for a period of time. Then it kaputs.<br /><br />I do notice that water does sheet on the glass differently than it would on 'normal' mirrors, I would think, so there is SOMETHING going on with it, but still, it ain't workin' like it should.
  1485. It works well and it's inexpensive. What else could you want in a fogless mirror!
  1486. Let me start by saying that I have Parkinson's, and while the medication can help control some of the tremors they don't necessarily stop them altogether. Tremors and balance problems are two issues I face daily, and being able to reduce the chances or falling is always a great thing. I know this probably sounds like an odd way to start this review, but those with Parkinson's of similar problems will hopefully appreciate the approach.<br /><br />There are quite a few fogless mirrors on the market, and I've used a half-dozen different forms of &#34;fogless&#34; over the years. I don't think, though, that I've ever had one that was as good, and offered multiple solutions to my daily problems. Let's start with the obvious issue, just how well does this product work to avoid fog. 100%. So far, in a couple weeks use, there has never been any fog on the mirror when I was ready to use it.<br /><br />When the hot water first starts there will be fog. The physics of the shower is that the fog has to heat the mirror to an equal temperature to the surrounding air. Not steaming, per se, but close enough to the ambient temperature that the steam/fog simply won't cling to the mirror. The trick, from what my friends in the science building tell me, is to use a surface that helps the mirror reach the ideal temperature in a reasonable amount of time. With this product that is achieved by the design (it's really thin) and the material (I'm not sure what it's made of, to be honest).<br /><br />On a more personal basis, the price to quality ratio is really good. You get the mirror, the hook, and then a separate hook for your razor. So you get to position it all in a place that is the most comfortable/convenient for you. In my case, and just over 6'1&#34; I needed something I could easily attach fairly high on the shower wall. I attached the hook for the mirror and the shaver hook at approximately the same height. This helped to keep both the mirror and shaver on a level that reduced the chance of hitting it with my shoulder was nil. In the past, I've used mirrors that hooked to the actual nozzle plumbing and that meant, with a lower shower head, you had a mirror that was way to easy to bump with your shoulder. A little thing, but it really is worthwhile to me.<br /><br />Another somewhat unexpected advantage was the strength of the sticky stuff on the back of the hooks. I've used a variety of two sided &#34;outdoor&#34; tapes in the past to hook things to the shower wall (mostly mirrors, of course) and in almost every instance the sticky would simply become unsticky; leaving my mirror on the floor, usually at the worst time.<br /><br />Finally, the whole thing comes together by the super customer service I've received without even asking for it. Almost immediately after I received my product I got an email from the seller. The email was simply a followup to the sale, but the important part was the time they took to help provide instructions. These folks are truly interested in giving you not only a good product but also showing that they care about the sale, even after it's made. In my case, I responded to tell them I'd just received the product and that I'd review it after I had a chance to use it. They were kind enough to thank me, offer to help if I needed anything else. They even &#34;reminded me&#34; to clean the foggless mirror just like I would my favorite sunglasses. I thought was a good tip and really appreciate the fact they were making it so easy.<br /><br />IN short, I'd not only recommend this product to a friend, I'm going to include it on my Christmas list for several of my male friends. I'd give it to female friends, too, but I'm not that politically correct. I just can't see any of my women friends holding their calf six-foot in the air to get a good shave.e chance of hitting it with my shoulder was nil. In the past, I've used mirrors that hooked to the actual nozzle plumbing and that meant, with a lower shower head, you had a mirror that was way to easy to bump with your shoulder. A little thing, but it really is worthwhile to me.<br /><br />Another somewhat unexpected advantage was the strength of the sticky stuff on the back of the hooks. I've used a variety of two sided &#34;outdoor&#34; tapes in the past to hook things to the shower wall (mostly mirrors, of course) and in almost every instance the sticky would simply become unsticky; leaving my mirror on the floor, usually at the worst time.<br /><br />Finally, the whole thing comes together by the super customer service I've received without even asking for it. Almost immediately after I received my product I got an email from the seller. The email was simply a followup to the sale, but the important part was the time they took to help provide instructions. These folks are truly interested in giving you not only a good product but also showing that they care about the sale, even after it's made. In my case, I responded to tell them I'd just received the product and that I'd review it after I had a chance to use it. They were kind enough to thank me, offer to help if I needed anything else. They even &#34;reminded me&#34; to clean the foggless mirror just like I would my favorite sunglasses. I thought was a good tip and really appreciate the fact they were making it so easy.<br /><br />IN short, I'd not only recommend this product to a friend, I'm going to include it on my Christmas list for several of my male friends. I'd give it to female friends, too, but I'm not that politically correct. I just can't see any of my women friends holding their calf six-foot in the air to get a good shave.

  1488. Like many stated, this is great at first. For me, that period of time was maybe 6-8 weeks. Now it fogs up and gets water drops all over it. I won't fault this product or company specifically, because EVERY shower mirror I've ever bought (and there have been a few) do this. Even all the &#34;fog free&#34; ones.<br /><br />Long story short...followed all directions and it still gives up the ability to stay clear in the shower after enough time. Maybe its just physics and unavoidable.<br /><br />My fix is to splash water on it constantly, or smear a bit of soap on it and you'll get a couple minutes of fairly clear use out of it. If the mirror stayed fog/water free for even half a year or so, I'd give it 4 stars...but not even 2-3 months is still leaving a lot to be desired.
  1489. I've been using this mirror for a week. No fogging and the hooks haven't gone anywhere. (Prior to adhering the hooks, I cleaned the area with shower cleaner and rinsed it well; then I cleaned it with rubbing alcohol and let it dry; I applied the hooks per the instructions and left them alone for 8 hours, then put the mirror on.) So far I'm enjoying having this mirror in my shower.

I replied to him, saying that these instructions were not clearly marked on the box, and next time I suggest that this email will be sent before you get the product.<br />The seller sent me a new mirror, without even me asking for it!!<br />And he promised that from now on, these instructions will be added to the order confirmation email (or in a separate email, but before you get the mirror).<br />A customer service at its best!<br /><br />And the product is great, as I already mentioned...
  1495. Picture an oval mirror hanging in space. It has no frame whatsoever which is good. You only get one try. Mine is off level a bit but hardly noticeable. I recommend that you tape a ruler to the shower wall and use that to guide your hook placement.

  1522. I was looking for a replacement shower mirror after the suction-cup version I had been using gave up on me after about 2 years of use. The suction cups simply don't last forever. When I received this new &#34;Fogless Shower Mirror&#34; I was shocked at how cheap it seemed - it is scarcely thicker than a piece of paper. Rather than suction cups, it uses adhesive panels (one for the mirror and one for the razor holder). I am skeptical of adhesive products used in the shower because they seldom hold up - even when applied properly. The razor holder gave up in about 5 days (must have been under-engineered as it was only supporting a featherweight disposable razor on the hook). The mirror has so far remained in place - but then again, it is about as thin as a sheet of paper so I suppose scotch tape would have held up as well. Four weeks into it so far and the mirror is not so &#34;fogless&#34; anymore. Since nearly anything of this nature we purchase now comes from China where production costs are next to nothing and transportation costs are more significant, distributors are looking for cheaper and lighter materials to use. Bottom line, this product isn't awful, it would be a good &#34;value&#34; at about $1.99 at a dollar store - if you buy this, you should consider it a disposable item. This is a real review from a real customer who actually purchased the product .

  1659. I had the opportunity to review the Cassani Fogless Shower Mirror which included a razor hook. It uses Anti-Fog Nanotechnology to prevent the mirror from fogging in the shower.<br /><br />Installation was easy. Just peel the back from the adhesive on the back of both the razor hook and the fogless shower mirror hook and stick them where you want them to be in the shower. Keep pressure on them for about 45 seconds and let them sit over night before hooking the mirror on it, and it’s ready to use.<br /><br />Now we have a mirror in the shower so that my husband can shave while showering and take advantage of the warm, moist air. I can put my razor on the razor hook so I can have it handy when I want to shave my legs.<br /><br />I highly recommend the Cassani Fogless Shower Mirror which included a razor hook, which really does work and is reasonably priced.<br /><br />How is The Cassani Shower Mirror Fogless?<br />By warming the mirror with the shower stream, the difference in temperature between the shower air and the mirror disappears. With mirror and shower being the same temperature, there will not be any fog.<br /><br />Where Should I NOT Place My Mirror?<br />We recommend you placing your mirror away from areas in the direct shower stream or where cooler air may enter from outside the shower. We also advise to try and keep the mirror away from spray as well. Do a test run first before placing your mirror and razor hooks.<br /><br />How To Attach My Wall Mounts?<br />1) Clean the area in your shower where you will put your mirror and razor hooks with rubbing alcohol and make sure the surface is very dry before putting the adhesives in place.<br />2) Place pressure on the hook(s) for 30-45 seconds<br />3) Allow the hooks a few hours to set before hanging anything on them. This will almost guarantee that your wall mounts stay in place as long as you need them to.<br /><br />What Is The Best Way To Clean My Shower Mirror?<br /><br />WARNING: Do NOT use cleaning products on this mirror.<br />Our Anti-Fog Nanotechnology is infused into the reflection surface. Using cleaning products here will very likely remove our anti-fog magic. We recommend using regular soap, or simply rinsing it with water. Any small amount of soap or even toothpaste can be rubbed on and rinsed off to clear away any water spots.<br /><br />I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.ng products on this mirror.<br />Our Anti-Fog Nanotechnology is infused into the reflection surface. Using cleaning products here will very likely remove our anti-fog magic. We recommend using regular soap, or simply rinsing it with water. Any small amount of soap or even toothpaste can be rubbed on and rinsed off to clear away any water spots.<br /><br />I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.
  1660. This product worked well for the first couple of weeks and now it fogs nearly as fast as a regular mirror
  1661. I have never heard of a fogless mirror prior to purchasing the Cassani Fogless Shower Mirror however, I am now a fan. Every bathroom should come equipped with at least one fogless mirror mounted on the wall. Initially, I had reservations about the placement of an additional mirror in our bathroom as we had just broken the plastic framing of a suction-cup mounted mirror. The design of this mirror is frameless and both the mirror wall mount and the razor wall mount easily and attached to the wall with the attached adhesive. I have no idea about the process behind the Anti-Fog Nanotechnology, but it works and that's all that matters. I am very satisfied with this mirror, the prompt shipping and the friendly customer service.

It came with clear instructions of how to properly stick the mounts for the mirror and razor holder.<br />Installation took just seconds!<br />This morning in the shower I could see..and clearly! How amazing after all these years, never really knowing what I was missing until I have this one hanging in my shower!<br /><br />I took a nice hot steamy shower, and the mirror never fogged a bit...now, if I could get that same technology on my bathroom mirror, I'd love that!<br /><br />My husband was very pleased as well. He's never been one to shower and shave in the shower, but I made him try it today!<br /><br />He is now going to make some shaving changes! He said he can see better, more close up, and since his face is warm from the water, he can get a much closer shave then shaving at the bathroom sink!<br /><br />That's a bonus for me since not only will his face be smoother longer, but now I will not have those pesky whiskers all over my bathroom sink area!<br /><br />I love that it came with the hook for the razor, so I can hang the razor instead of having it sit on the ledge of my shower. Nice bonus!<br /><br />Great product, highly recommend!

  1782. It is not fogless..... when used inside the shower.
  1783. I would not buy this mirror at this time. If you receive one of our substandard mirrors please contact us so we can send out a new mirror or issue you a full refund immediately. If you splash water on it will clear up for 20 seconds or so. I have contacted the merchant on their website via their contact form 4 days ago without an answer.   1792. ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ They've nailed it. Out of all of the fog less shower mirrors on the market, this one works. It is unencumbered by unnecessary mounts, brackets, springs, and suction cups. It works because it's simple.
  1793. When I was doing research to replace an old and useless shower mirror, this one caught my eye because of the customer ratings. In my view a product with less than ten percent one ratings and over fifty percent fives is probably a decent one. All manufacturing processes have quality assurance programs, but occasionally a defective product slips through the cracks. It is simply a matter of how big the cracks and I figured I had a pretty good chance of getting a decent product so I bought it. Unfortunately, the one I got failed the test. Almost immediately the anti-fog coating developed hairline cracks and started to peel off. After a week or so, it was almost completely useless and I would have returned it to amazon and rated it a one had I not gotten an email from the company asking me how I liked the mirror and requesting that I give them a good review on amazon. They also asked that I contact them if there were andy issues or problems, so I decided to do so before returning it. Finding their email was bit of challenge because correspondence coming through amazon automatically deletes contact information, but I prevailed and contacted their customer service. I was pleasantly surprised at how fast they responded and after sending them a picture of the mirror, they sent me a new one, which arrived the next day. The replacement mirror is much better and works pretty well. It has been a cold winter and most mornings the bathroom is cold and the shower is hot. The mirror does fog up a little bit under these conditions, but a rinse under the hot water takes care of the fogging problem, which is very minor.<br /><br />I would probably have given this product either a three or four star rating, if not for their customer service. Any company that follows up, does what it says it will do, and does it when they say they will do it deserves the highest rating in my book. Buy the product and if you are unlucky enough to get a defective one, contact them and they willmake it right.
  1794. Didn't work and cheaply made

I bought one just before I moved to another house and left it for the next tenant rather than trying to remove it from the wall of the shower. Just bought another one instead.
  1796. I find the need to constantly wet the mirror in order to reduce/ eliminate fogging.
  1797. Finally, no more razor burn. The mirror does smudge a bit but easy fix i just brush it with water with my fingers. Just make sure to place at face level while you're standing in shower as you normally would.

  1812. I feel the need to post a review here, mostly because I feel a bit misled by the enormous amount of positive reviews. First, let's start with the positive and just say that the customer service of the company is top-notch. When I got my first mirror and assumed it was defective because of how quickly and dramatically it fogged up, I sent an email stating as such to the company. I immediately got a response apologizing for the fact the mirror didn't work and was told a new mirror would be on its way ASAP. Indeed, I received the mirror and was hopeful that the second mirror would provide a better experience. Sadly, it fogged up almost as badly as the first (and even had a few small scratches on it).<br /><br />So just getting to the product. The mirror itself looks kind of cloudy to begin with as it doesn't appear to be exactly a glass product; I just assumed that had something to do with trying to make the mirror fogless. given the mirror is far from fogless, i'm guessing it has more to do with making the product inexpensive. I did dig the enclosed mirror and razor holders - they stuck to the tile nicely and look pretty decent so i will use them. Unfortunately, the mirror itself just doesn't do the job; despite following all of the recommended tips and suggestions, the mirror basically fogs up within a couple of minutes at most (admittedly, I do like a hot shower, so maybe it would do a better job in a lukewarm shower -but then what's the point of that).<br /><br />By spraying the mirror with water you are able to remove most of the fog (reminds me of the zadro mirror i used before), but it comes back pretty quickly so getting a shave is not so easy to do without constant resplashing the mirror with water. Anyway, the product would get one star, but the appreciated customer service bumps it up a notch.

  1820. Now as a woman, I can’t tell you about shaving my face because I don’t have anything there to shave :-) But my husband does have a goatee and he really did like using it in the shower to help with trimming up his face. I can also see where it would be beneficial for women to help shave their bikini area as well.<br /><br />But where I found the mirror to be the most helpful was when I dyed my hair and I was able to not only take the mirror off the hook it comes with me and move it around to use outside of the shower to make sure that I had the back of my hair covered.<br /><br />But what I absolutely loved was using it in the shower rinsing the dye out of my hair, I was able to make sure that I had all of the dye off of my hairline. As someone who dyes their hair pink, it is super important to make sure that you rinse until the water runs clear and with the mirror I was able to use it see the water actually coming off my hair instead of relying on the water at the bottom of the shower. Which incidentally turns the tub base pink temporarily and makes it difficult to see if your truly getting clear water running off your hair.<br /><br />Unless you are running extremely hot water, the mirror does live up to the promise of not fogging up and if it does fog, per the instructions just give it a quick rinse and it will prevent it from fogging up again. I did find that to be true to an extent, your really do need to run it under the water to bring it up closer in temperature to the temperature in the shower to prevent it from fogging up.<br /><br />On a separate note, when I was first opened it up and was looking at it, my English Mastiff was throughly enthralled with the mirror and her reflection. Many times she walked up and put her nose directly on the mirror and it never fogged up. She also loved trying to find out where that other dog was :)<br /><br />All around this is a great mirror for in the shower.

  1839. *Disclaimer* I was sent this product for free for review purposes. ALL opinions and thought are my own.<br /><br />When the opportunity arose to review this product, I had to ask myself, would I, as a woman, use this? Would my husband use this? As he is currently refusing to shave his beard! But, I decided, what the heck? Why not, it couldn't hurt to check it out.<br /><br />Installation was super easy. The instructions state to clean the area and make sure it is completely dry, peal off the backing of the foam sticker, press it to the desired area firmly for 2 minutes. I followed the instructions and was able to install both the mirror mount and razor mount in under 5 minutes. I decided to install the mirror opposite of the faucet as I felt that would be the best area to be able to see my face without having water running down it.<br /><br />I've been using the mirror for almost 2 weeks now. I have to say that I am impressed. The mirror hasn't fogged once and surprisingly I've used it myself! I find it easier to wash my face in the shower and even shave my underarms! As odd as it sounds, I feel more comfortable being able to inspect and see that I got every hair! I also seem to have developed an obsession with staring at myself while I wash my hair! My husband was even impressed, his exact words were “I'm pretty sure that's a mirror from hell, I stood in front of it breathing onto it and it didn't fog!” Yes, that's his unique way of telling me he likes it lol.<br /><br />In addition to what I stated above, some other things I like about the Cassani Fogless Shower Mirror are it's design. It will look good in any bathroom décor. It's very lightweight, so I don't feel that it will fall under it's weight.<br /><br />One thing to pay special attention to is cleaning. The instructions are very specific in how to clean the mirror. They state to not use any chemicals on the mirror and to only use water and a soft cloth. They say using chemicals on the mirror can destroy some of the anti-fogging properties.<br /><br />I do have some concerns though. The mirror seems to be mounted on a type of cardboard and I worry that in time it will possibly getting soggy or mold. I also wonder how easy it will be to remove and reinstall.<br /><br />Despite my concerns, I fully recommend the Cassani Fogless Shower Mirror. Everything that Cassani has claimed seems to be true.
  1840. It works great, but not for long. I've now had three of them, and the same thing has happened each time-they fail in two or three months. When the mirror is just out of the box it is great. No fog at all. I think that it doesn't fog because the reflective surface seems to be covered with a very low-surface tension coating. Water doesn't bead up; instead it spreads out and covers the surface of the mirror evenly. So no fog can form over the thin coating of water because steam condensing onto water just makes...more water. Clever. But the coating, as other negative reviews note, is very fragile. It is damaged with minimal contact. My third and final mirror became scratched and non-functional with almost no handling. Maybe occasional contact with fingers or a washcloth, that's all, at least as far as I could tell. I certainly tried to be careful with it. Maybe Amazon could offer a subscription so that it would automatically be replaced 4 times a year. Or maybe you'll buy something else. That's my solution now.
  1841. I've been shaving for about 20 years so I consider myself an expert in the field. This mirror reflects light in a way that makes it appear as if there's another world inside of it with a person that looks just like you. Buy it just for that reason!!
  1842. It worked great for the first little bit, but it stopped working within 3 months. It fogs up now immediately and every time. I've finally resorted to putting a little soap on it and that seems to work, but then why even purchase a fog free mirror?

  1870. This is a follow up review (April 24, 2015) Tried everything I could, including water surface tension reduction sprays. Nothing seems to work very well. I'll look for something else to do a more credible job; Nanotechnology isn't it, though it sounds good. For now, it's back to the sink when shaving. Will post again, IF I come up with a more suitable solution. Purchased Product on March 12, 2015. Installation was a breeze, and both mirror and shaver holder are doing what they are supposed to. However, after using it a few times, the mirror started to show fine drops (NOT fog) and even after splashing it and turning shower off, the drops formed again within seconds from the water layer on the mirror. Appears that water surface tension helps in forming drops, impairing the mirrors use significantly and degrading the shaving process pretty much to a tactile operation. Don't know if spraying it with a surface tension reducing spray would help. Haven't done so yet because I wanted to strictly follow the manufacturers directions. However, the 'Nanotechnology' is definitely gone. -I am at a loss; really wanted it to work well, but don't know how to do so. Maybe some advice from the supplier??
  1871. 1 week into it...but love it. It is clear even in a hot shower, and since I put it right on top of the old mirror that came with the shower column, I can really see the difference. Great product - and love the hang hook that it comes with -- seems to be holding up well in the shower.
  1872. ehh its ok but when it gets steamy you can see anything in it
  1873. What happen? For the first four days this mirror was fog free I thought wow finally a fogless shower mirror that lives up to it's name.Then day 5 it started fogging up like all the others and I kept having to clean it off with water to finish my morning shave.<br /><br />Yes I followed the directions, yes I pulled the plastic film off and no my showers are not the hottest I can stand. Maybe one day there will be a fogless shower mirror that truly stands up to it's name but unfortunately this is not one of them. Keep looking my friend!
  1874. I paid more for this product because of its nanotechnology. It is so &#34;nano&#34; it is not existent. Fogs every time. I followed the directions. Adjusted my shower head so it doesn't touch the mirror, made sure my fan in the bathroom is on....nothing works. If I place it under the running water it clears for a brief few seconds and then it is foggy again. The only thing I got out of this was a nice hanger for my razor. I will have to remember to take a dry washcloth with me in the shower if I intend to use this mirror. I have been an avid Amazon shopper for years, but I just think the company is getting to big. I have had several problems over the past year with either the product being inferior or shipping problems. If anyone out there knows of another company similar to Amazon, I sure would like to know it as I live in a rural area and do a lot of online shopping. Thanks.
  1875. Unfortunately, we have VERY hard water, so it has streaked something horrid after a few months use. Not the product's problem, but since I can't use anything to clean the hard water stains off, I can't give it any higher rating. I will say that using the double-sided sticky tape and metal hook keeps it from falling off the shower wall, which our previous mirror's suction cup was notorious for, usually in the middle of the night...
  1876. This mirror is as good as described. I will caution you to listen to the seller's instructions on care. I have a cleaning person and forgot to tell them not to clean this, and they ended up scratching it. Treat it like you expensive sunglasses, clean with water and a tissue, and you have the perfect shower shaving solution (say that five times fast)
  1877. I like the previous one I purchased from the same place better. It was square. This one started water spotting a few times after using and now you can hardly see in it. It has never been washed, only rinsed in the shower as directed, so I don't know what happened this time? I haven't ordered another one because it is getting a little expensive after buying 2 already.
  1878. I have used the product for 8 months. It was easy to mount in a tile shower. It is used almost daily. I rarely write reviews, but this product is awesome.
  1879. Product is exactly as described. After using it for the first week I went to clean it exactly as described in the instructions. Essentially, the instructions say to clean it as it were sunglasses. All I did was wash it with water than dry it off with a brand new lint free microfiber towel. The surface ended up getting completely scratched. If you get this mirror, do not attempt to dry it or clean it with any type of cloth because it will scratch it up. Other than that, it truly does not fog up and has great clarity....before I tried cleaning it.
  1880. I liked this mirror at first, and read the literature which explained that you are to clean this mirror with only a soft cloth and no chemicals. So I was disappointed when, after 1 week of use, I used warm water and a tissue to clean the mirror, and just that easily there are permanent scratches.
  1881. So far excellent product as well as superior follow up and instructions for use.
  1882. Lasted only 2 weeks. This is real piece of garbage. Don't fall for false reviews.
  1883. I have tried many &#34;fogless&#34; shaving mirrors. So far this is the best. Just rinse it with water and wipe with your fingers and its clean. I liked it so much i bought two more for my sons.
  1884. The mirror was fantastic for about a month or so, but this morning I jumped in the shower and it was like someone flipped a switch and the mirror no longer works foglessly. It fogs up within seconds now, and the water beads up on the surface, as if there were some kind of treatment that's just no longer coating the mirror. I have no idea what kept it fogless originally, but whatever it is, the magic is gone, and this product is completely useless now. I originally rated this 5 stars, but seeing as it's now just a paperweight, it's down to 1. :(
  1885. Over two months in and I couldn't be more pleased. My wife threw the box away after a few days of opening and before I had installed it. If I had the box, I would have returned this item. It isn't worth a dollar bill.<br />Lately I just discovered that rubbing some left over Gillette shaving gel onto the mirror and then rinsing it off after a minute or two that it would not fog up but just be covered in droplets. I may try to use some Rain-X or Fog-X on it to see if this can be salvaged.<br />I cannot believe all the great reviews. They must have been written during the first few days of use.

  1907. Exactly as advertised--a fogless shower mirror. It's a simple mirrored oval, about 8 inches tall and 6 inches wide, with a small cutout at the top to hang it on the included stainless adhesive-backed hook. It also comes with a stainless adhesive-backed razor holder. The mirror face shows water spots/residue after a few uses, but they disappear after a few seconds under warm water. All-in-all, a good product.

  1910. Very good little mirror. Terrific that it doesn't hang on suction cups which always fail, but definitely follow the directions and give the adhesive on the backside of the mirror hook and razor hook time to set. If you do, you won't have any worries about the mirror falling. Because it is technically hanging from a hook, it hangs nice and plumb without any warping of the image and faces directly at you, whereas with suction cup held mirrors, sometimes the mirror surface flexes because of the contour of your shower wall. That doesn't happen with this mirror.<br /><br />I read the reviews on the potential for scratching and quite frankly I have just avoided touching it at all. I have had it for about 3 weeks or so and it hasn't fogged once or needed to be cleaned and has been hit with the shower sprayer a couple of times with no ill affect. I would recommend this mirror and if you have kids (I have 6) who use that shower, hang it high and tell them how easily it can scratch. Mine have left it alone.
  1911. Anti-fog only lasted a few months before just acting like a regular mirror. It fogs up before the glass on the shower door does now. The hooks for mounting the mirror and razor are indeed quick and easy to setup and seem to last, but that's not what I bought this for.
  1912. Works well enough. Got sort of a film to it after a while, but still works fine. Would not give up shaving in the shower for the world, by the way. Getting great mileage even from my cheap razors.
  1913. Does exactly what I need it to. Simple to hang and stays unfogged while being used in the shower.
  1914. Worked nice when I first got it... for a few weeks or so all was well. By the end of the first month, it seemed like a few little &#34;spots&#34; decided to form on the mirror, where water seems to stick like glue, not a big deal though; just splash some water on and all is well. Another month after that and now the mirror is covered in these spots that water sticks to, I have to wipe the mirror off with my hand and then rinse it off with water every time before using it now. This is only two months after purchase. I have never touched it with any cleaner, any cloth, nothing has ever touched this mirror except for air, water, and my (clean, soap-free) hand, and yet it can not seem to maintain the same level of non-water-magnetism as the hundreds of wall tiles behind it that it's mounted on... ever think of just making ceramic reflective? Seems like that would work much better.
  1915. I've always wanted a shower mirror for shaving that I could both hold in my hand and put on the shower wall, didn't fog up after 5 seconds (bonus if it just didn't fog up at all), and was large enough so I could see a decent amount of my face at one time. I had come to the conclusion that these three qualities being present in a single product must be unreasonable. After nearly 15 years of shaving in the shower I still hadn't found a mirror that didn't have at least one of the qualities missing. Most are worse than that!<br /><br />I am still in awe. I have finally found such a mirror. As you might notice from the box it is nothing more than a mirror hanging up on a metal hook. This makes going from holding it to hanging it up simple and easy. I placed it fairly close to the path of the water stream and I have yet to see a fog form. And when on the hook it's large enough to see everything I am shaving on my neck and face at once.<br /><br />Compared to anything else I've ever owned, I give this thing a 10/10 (or 5 stars or whatever).
  1916. I bought this for my husband as he frequently shaves in the shower. I got to tell you he loves it and I love it too. It is so clear and there is absolutely no problem seeing what you are shaving in the mirror. What a great product.   1929. Okay, I've purchased 2 of these now. The first one was fantastic and it lasted about a year before I made the mistake of trying to clean it with toothpaste (I know it was dumb). I bought it again because the first time the mirror was perfectly flat and the anti fog feature worked great as long as you followed the directions and warmed it up in the shower stream first. I live in Florida and don't have a water softener so I don't knock off any points (stars) for the mirror needing cleaning. We have hard water and the fact that it lasted a year before getting any spots is actually a testament to how well this thing was made.<br /><br />Now, for the bad news. The SECOND one I purchased was horrible! The mirror was warbled/distorted and the anti fog feature was non-existent. After a couple of days I saw a tiny, thin, film start to peel from the surface of the mirror. I can only assume that this is the anti fog &#34;coating&#34;.(?) And before anyone suggests this; No, it was not the &#34;protective&#34; plastic coating that ships with it. Right now I'm going on the premise that there was a bad production run maybe because it seems odd that I had 2 completely different experiences.<br /><br />The company was great about refunding my money and I will give it another shot with a third one. I will return here and update with my review of the third one!

  1954. I have to tell this story, because customer service is my forte. The Cassani Company actually reached out to me via email and admitted there may be a problem with their product, &#34;an error in production&#34; they said. So now my radar was up, was this product really worth the $15.00 (plus shipping)?<br />After receiving that first shipment, they were correct -- fog city, not even two minutes into my shower. I let the company rep know via email and just four days later I received my replacement mirror. So during my morning shower I purposely let the steam build up and I'll be a nanotechnologist... NO FOG whatsoever.<br />I'll be sure to follow the care instructions and never let a towel or wash rag come near this thing. My Shower Tek mirror (with the water running through it to prevent steam build up) was the absolute bomb for about seven years, until corrosion got the better of it. I couldn't find a replacement for the Shower Tek, so I only hope this product lasts half as long as its predecessor. I'm a happy camper Cassani!!

  1958. What do you think of mirrors in the shower? Do you use them? Now thank god as I have aged I have not started to sprout a beard - yet! However I love having a mirror on hand when I put hair dye on while sitting in the tub. Needless to say most of the time I end up with red dye on my ears, by my cheeks and just about anywhere it should not be. Taking a mirror along was useless since it would always fog up anyways, until I was send the Fogless Shower Mirror by Cassani to try it out.<br /><br />Well, hello there! The mirror has some sort of anti-fog nanotechnology that prevents the mirror from fogging up. The mirror is send with a stainless steel mirror wall hook, a wall razor holder and of course the mirror itself. I hate suction cups and thankfully adhesive pads are send that actually work quiet well.<br /><br />I was surprised to see that the mirror barely fogged up. While testing it I really had to just have extremely hot water running in order to see it slightly fog up. Under normal shower and bathing conditions it did not fog up and I liked it so much that I am going to buy an extra one for my husbands shower.
  1959. This is a great product. I have used a ShowerTek mirror for years and I decided it was time for an upgrade. This mirror does not require attachment to the shower head and is aesthetically more pleasing. The design is great with simple brushed metal hook attachments. Installation takes 5 minutes . I have had none of the problems with fogging noted in other reviews. Cleaning just involves rInsing under the shower. I highly recommend.
  1960. How is this fog-less? From the first time I used it, this thing fogged up, so I don't understand the raving reviews, unless, of course, I got a dud. Anyway, mine is NOT fog-less at all. Also, way overpriced for what it is.
